## Nutanix Prism Central Overview

This dashboard provides comprehensive monitoring for Nutanix Prism Central, clusters, hosts, and virtual machines. Monitor cluster health, resource utilization, performance metrics, and alerts to ensure optimal operation of your Nutanix infrastructure.

**Key Features:**
- Health status monitoring for Prism Central and clusters
- Resource utilization tracking (CPU, memory, storage)
- Performance metrics (IOPS, throughput, latency)
- Host and VM monitoring
- Alert tracking and event monitoring

**Useful Links:**
- [Nutanix Integration Documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/integrations/nutanix/)
- [Nutanix Prism Central API](https://www.nutanix.dev/api-reference/prism-central/)

## Nutanix Prism Central Overview

Monitor your Nutanix infrastructure including Prism Central, clusters, hosts, and virtual machines. Track health status, resource utilization, performance metrics, and alerts.

**Key Metrics:**
- Health and availability status
- CPU, memory, and storage utilization
- IOPS, throughput, and latency
- Active alerts and events
Monitor the overall health of your Nutanix environment. The health metric indicates connectivity to Prism Central, while cluster availability shows which clusters are operational.
Monitor CPU, memory, and storage utilization across your Nutanix clusters. High utilization may indicate the need for capacity planning or workload balancing.
Track storage performance metrics including IOPS (Input/Output Operations Per Second), throughput, and latency for read and write operations.
Monitor individual host performance including CPU, memory usage, and disk/network I/O. Use these metrics to identify problematic hosts or capacity constraints.
Monitor virtual machine performance and resource consumption across your Nutanix clusters. Track VM counts, CPU, memory, disk I/O, and network throughput.
Monitor alerts and events from your Nutanix environment. Critical and warning alerts require immediate attention to maintain system health and availability.
Additional cluster information including node counts, redundancy factor, and storage container details.
